title.narrative: GPSA Reinforcing social accountability in health

description.narrative: Administrators in 8 out of 34 health zones in South Kivu, Bas Congo and 3 out of 31 in Bas Congo will be trained in the role of Health Facility In these 11 health zones, the project will develop the HFC in 190 health centres that cover a population of 2 million people.

The project aims to improve the provision of health care in the provinces of South Kivu and Bas Congo by strengthening the role of the Health Facility Committees. This is a body comprising health staff and elected members of the community that offers a platform for expressing community concerns and holding the health facility accountable for their services or lack thereof. Existing HFC are generally not functioning well due to the lack of clarity on their role (terms of reference) and the weak capacity of community members to voice their concerns. In total, 190 HFC will be strengthened.

The quality of health care in Congo is still below standard due to, amongst others, the lack social accountability of providers to the population. The project seeks to strengthen the functioning of Health Facility committees as a means to voice the needs and concerns of community members.
